title: Mullins, Buffalo Gap cage Stuarts Draft
text:
Mullins, Buffalo Gap cage Stuarts Draft Eden Otero , eotero@newsleader.com 11:27 p.m. EDT October 9, 2015 David Mullins 73 CONNECT 1 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
BUFFALO GAP — Like most games for the last two weeks, the Buffalo Gap and Stuarts Draft football teams endured the rain that, at this point in the season, seemed unrelenting. 
But, even after the rain stopped and the teams finally got on the field, it was a game worth waiting for as fans saw both the Bison and Cougars battle it out. 
“Our guys were kind of against the odds there,” Buffalo Gap coach Andy Cline said. “We were down a couple of times; we got pushed back, but they finished and that’s what you want to see. ... I knew (Stuarts Draft) was going to be tough. They’re a good football team. They’ve got some tough kids and a lot of speed.” 
While Buffalo Gap won 22-14, it wasn’t without a fight from Stuarts Draft. 
Playing on a field was chewed to a slippery mess, making it a test to hold on to a ball slicked with mud, Draft found a running game that stumped the Gap defense on multiple drives, including the Cougars’ first of the game, when senior running back Marston Jones took off for a 78-yard touchdown. 
“He’s a fast kid and they’re capable at any time to pop him one way,” Cline said. “Our kids stepped up and played after that first (touchdown). It took us some time to get up to that speed.” 
But the most dominant player on the field for Gap was David Mullins who picked up all three of the Bison’s touchdowns 
Mullins is Gap’s biggest back, and can punch through even the smallest holes, something he proved when he went toe-to-toe with a strong Stuarts Draft defense. 
“I feel like I say this every week, but in these kind of (rainy) conditions it’s nice to have him there to stick him with the ball and get some yards,” Cline said. 
STUARTS DRAFT 7 0 0 7 — 14 
BUFFALO GAP 14 0 8 0 — 22 
First Quarter 
SD — Marston Jones 78 run (Wyrick kick) 
BG — David Mullins 21 run (Pass failed) 
BG — David Mullins 11 run (Comer pass from Wheeler) 
Third Quarter 
BG — David Mullins 3 run (Mullins run)
